elements.title: Nicolaas van Wijk
elements.contents: ... that Nicolaas van Wijk (pictured), after helping to provide humanitarian aid during World War I, called the Partitions of Poland "an offense against God"?

elements.title: Rescatemos a David y Miguel
elements.contents: ... that the Rescatemos a David y Miguel memorial was installed seven years ago today in response to a kidnapping that occurred thirteen years ago today?

elements.title: Carol and Eric Hafner
elements.contents: ... that Carol and Eric Hafner ran for five United States House of Representatives seats for states in which they did not live, and mostly had not visited?

elements.title: the first modern Chinese play
elements.contents: ... that the first modern Chinese play was based on an American novel and staged in Tokyo?

elements.title: ketchup chips
elements.contents: ... that ketchup chips were introduced in the 1970s along with other flavours such as grape and orange?

elements.title: Tsybin Ts-25
elements.contents: ... that the military glider Tsybin Ts-25 was considered for use as a civilian airliner?

elements.title: Man of Smoke
elements.contents: ... that the futurist novel Man of Smoke, according to a scholar, contains a hidden legal code for readers to piece together?

elements.title: Pokémon Scarlet and Violet
elements.contents: ... that Pokémon Scarlet and Violet became the lowest-rated mainline entries in the franchise's history due to performance issues at launch?

elements.title: Mirza Ebrahim Khan Sahhafbashi
elements.contents: ... that Mirza Ebrahim Khan Sahhafbashi opened the first commercial movie theater in Iran, only for it to be banned within a month?
